required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tiotropium in the Treatment of the Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Use Results Survey of Tiotropium Bromide

brief_summary.textblock: To collect post-marketing safety and effectiveness information on the use of Tiotropium Inhalation Capsules (18 Î¼g) in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in daily clinical settings

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after start of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse drug reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after start of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with serious adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after start of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's overall judgement by medical interview into four grades: 1. Improved 2. No Change 3. Aggravated 4.Unassessable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 weeks after start of treatment

intervention.description: Survey of patients with COPD using Spiriva (tiotropium bromide) inhalation capsules

study_pop.textblock: COPD patients in daily clinical settings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with COPD
Exclusion Criteria:
-There is no exclusion criterion, because this post marketing study (PMS) is observational survey under condition of normal clinical practice
